00042 /**
00043  *  TableFile - File for reading and using files that have delimited
00044  *                    rows of data. Specifically for R table files and the 
00045  *                    like. 
00046  */
00047 class TableFile {
00048 
00049 public: 
00050 
00051   /// Error value indicating not found.
00052   static const unsigned int npos = UINT_MAX;
00053 
00054   /** 
00055    * Constructor.
00056    * @param delim - Character to use for word separator. i.e. ',' or '\\t'
00057    * @param comment - Character that comment lines begin with.
00058    * @param useRowNames - Is first column the names of the rows?
00059    * @param useColNames - Is the first row the column headers?
00060    */
00061   TableFile(char delim = '\t', char comment = '#', bool useRowNames = false, bool useColNames = true);
00062 
00063   /** 
00064    * Destructor.
00065    */
00066   ~TableFile();
00067 
00068   /** 
00069    * Read data from file specified.
00070    * @param fileName - file to be read.
00071    * @return - true if successful.
00072    */
00073   bool open(const std::string& fileName);
00074 
00075   /** 
00076    * Read data from file specified.
00077    * @param fileName - file to be read.
00078    * @param requiredCols - column names that must be present.
00079    * @return - true if successful.
00080    */
00081   bool open(const std::string& fileName, const std::vector<std::string> &requiredCols);
00082 
00083   /** 
00084    * Write data to file specified.
00085    * @param fileName - name of file to write to.
00086    * @return - true if successful.
00087    */
00088   bool write(const std::string& fileName);
00089 
00090   /** 
00091    * Return number of columns in data.
00092    * @return - number of columns.
00093    */
00094   size_t numCols() { return m_ColNames.size(); }
00095 
00096   /** 
00097    * Return number of rows in data.
00098    * @return - number of rows.
00099    */
00100   size_t numRows() { return m_RowNames.size(); }
00101 
00102   /** 
00103    * Look up the index of column with name specified.
00104    * @param colName - Name of column of interest.
00105    * @return - npos if not found, column index otherwise.
00106    */
00107   unsigned int colIndex(const std::string& colName);
00108 
00109   /** 
00110    * Look up the index of row with name specified.
00111    * @param rowName - Name of row of interest.
00112    * @return - npos if not found, row index otherwise.
00113    */
00114   unsigned int rowIndex(const std::string& rowName);
00115 
00116   /** 
00117    * Return data at the position specified in table.
00118    * @param rowIx - row number.
00119    * @param colIx - column number.
00120    * @return - string representation of data.
00121    */
00122   std::string &getData(unsigned int rowIx, unsigned int colIx) { 
00123     return m_Data.at(rowIx).at(colIx); 
00124   }
00125 
00126   /** 
00127    * Return column name at specified index.
00128    * @param colIx - column number of interest.
00129    * @return - reference to column name at index of interest.
00130    */
00131   std::string &getColName(unsigned int colIx) { return m_ColNames.at(colIx); }
00132 
00133   /** 
00134    * Return row name at specified index.
00135    * @param rowIx - Row number of interest.
00136    * @return - reference to row name at index of interest.
00137    */
00138   std::string &getRowName(size_t rowIx) { return m_RowNames.at(rowIx); }
00139 
00140   /** 
00141    * Write out words in vector delimited by specified character.
00142    * @param out - stream to write to.
00143    * @param data - vector of data to write.
00144    * @param delim - delimiter to separate words with.
00145    */
00146   static void writeVector(std::ostream &out, std::vector<std::string> data, char delim);
00147 
00148   /** 
00149    * Rip the column out of a file by name filling in the data in colVec.
00150    * 
00151    * @param fileName - File to read column from.
00152    * @param colVec - Strings to be filled in from column.
00153    * @param colName - Name of column to be read in.
00154    * @param skipCols - Number of (non-commented) rows to skip before header.
00155    * @param unique - If true check to make sure every entry is unique.
00156    * 
00157    * @return true if successful false otherwise.
00158    */
00159   static bool columnFromFile(const std::string& fileName,
00160                              std::vector<std::string> &colVec, 
00161                              const std::string& colName,
00162                              unsigned int skipCols, bool unique=false);
00163 
00164   /** 
00165    * Rip the column out of a file by index filling in the data in colVec.
00166    * 
00167    * @param fileName - File to read column from.
00168    * @param colVec - Strings to be filled in from column.
00169    * @param colIx - Column index to read.
00170    * @param skipCols - Number of (non-commented) rows to skip before header.
00171    * @param unique - If true check to make sure every entry is unique.
00172    * 
00173    * @return true if successful false otherwise.
00174    */
00175   static bool columnFromFile(const std::string& fileName,
00176                              std::vector<std::string> &colVec, 
00177                              unsigned int colIx, unsigned int skipCols, bool unique=false);
00178   
00179   /** 
00180    * Rip a column out of an open RowFile.
00181    * 
00182    * @param rf - RowFile to read from.
00183    * @param colVec - Strings to be filled in with column's data.
00184    * @param colIx - Column index to read.
00185    * @param unique - If true check to make sure every entry is unique.
00186    * 
00187    * @return true if successful false otherwise.
00188    */
00189   static bool columnFromRowFile(RowFile &rf, std::vector<std::string> &colVec, 
00190                                 unsigned int colIx, bool unique=false);
00191   /** 
00192    * @brief Change state to use row names.
00193    */  
00194   inline void setUseRowNames() { m_UseRowNames = true; }
00195 
00196   /** 
00197    * @brief Are we using row names?
00198    * @return true if using row names, false otherwise.
00199    */
00200   inline bool getUseRowNames() { return m_UseRowNames; }
00201 
00202   /** 
00203    * Set the flag to look for column names (i.e. column headers).
00204    * @param use - should column names be used
00205    */  
00206   inline void setUseColNames(bool use) { m_UseColNames = use; }
00207 
00208   /** 
00209    * Set the flag to look for row names (i.e. row ids).
00210    * @param use - should row names be used
00211    */  
00212   inline void setUseRowNames(bool use) { m_UseRowNames = use; }
00213 
00214   /** 
00215    * @brief Get the value of a layout key=value header pair.
00216    * @param key String to lookup value of.
00217    * 
00218    * @return value of key/value pair.
00219    */
00220   const std::vector<std::string> &getHeaderValue(const std::string &key) { 
00221     std::map<std::string, std::vector<std::string> >::iterator iter;
00222     iter = m_Header.find(key);
00223     if(iter == m_Header.end())
00224       Err::errAbort("Don't recognize header key: " + key);
00225     return iter->second;
00226   }
00227 
00228 private:
00229   
00230   char m_Delim;              ///< Delimiter in table.
00231   char m_Comment;            ///< Comment character for data.
00232   bool m_UseRowNames;        ///< Should row names be expected
00233   bool m_UseColNames;        ///< Should row names be expected
00234   ///< Header parameters from %thisKey=thisParam
00235   std::map<std::string, std::vector<std::string> > m_Header;    
00236   ///< All header lines for easy recovery.    
00237   std::vector<std::string> m_HeaderLines;   
00238   ///< Name of columns.      
00239   std::vector<std::string> m_ColNames;      
00240  ///< Name of rows.
00241   std::vector<std::string> m_RowNames;           
00242   ///< Core table of words.
00243   std::vector< std::vector<std::string> > m_Data;      
00244 
00245   /** Iterator to walk through the map. */
00246   typedef std::map<std::string, unsigned int, Util::ltstring>::iterator TMapIter;
00247   /** Iterator to walk through the map. */
00248   typedef const std::map<std::string, unsigned int, Util::ltstring>::iterator TMapConstIter;
00249 
00250   /** Used as hash of column names. */
00251   std::map<std::string, unsigned int, Util::ltstring> m_ColNameMap;
00252   /** Used as hash of row names. */
00253   std::map<std::string, unsigned int, Util::ltstring> m_RowNameMap;
00254   /** Way to quickly free up memory in hash. */
00255   std::vector<char *> m_MemToFree; 
00256 };
